title: HARVESTER MACHINE HARVEST CROPS | NO COPYRIGHT VIDEO | NO COPYRIGHT VIDEO BACKGROUND | 4K | HD

tasks.task: Chambering stones with a boulder chucker
subtasks: Grasping the handle of the boulder chucker
Coordinating arm and shoulder muscles to swing the weapon
Applying force to launch the boulder
Adjusting aim based on previous trajectory or by visual estimation
Following through after releasing the boulder

tasks.task: Carrying a stone in each hand
subtasks: Lifting the stones from the ground
Balancing stones in both hands while moving
Adjusting grip as needed while walking or running
Dropping stones into a pile or designated area

tasks.task: Throwing stones over a wall
subtasks: Positioning oneself at the edge of the wall
Sitting or crouching to gain momentum
Gripping the stones and rotating body for power
Leaping to increase range and accuracy
Releasing the stones over the wall with force

tasks.task: Kneeling down to load the boulder chucker
subtasks: Squatting to the ground with hands on the ground near the chucker
Lowering buttocks to rest on the ground while keeping feet on the ground
Aligning the chucker with the direction of the intended target
Adjusting position as needed for optimal throwing angle

tasks.task: Digging a hole with a spade
subtasks: Stabilizing the spade in the ground with the non-dominant hand
Thrusting the spade into the soil with the dominant hand
Rocking the spade back and forth to break up the earth
Slashing the soil with downward motions
Removing the displaced soil from the hole
Continuing until the desired depth is achieved

tasks.task: Stooping down to retrieve a stone
subtasks: Bending at the waist while keeping knees bent
Reaching down with one or both hands to pick up the stone
Standing back up while retaining the grip on the stone

tasks.task: Pushing with a shovel
subtasks: Planting the shovel blade into the ground with both hands
Pushing the shovel toward the body to lift the ground material
Kneeling down to use leverage for pushing
Tipping the material into a pile or container
Repeating the motion in a cyclic manner

tasks.task: Dropping a stone into a pile
subtasks: Extending arm with stone towards the pile
Grasping the stone at the last second before release
Letting go of the stone to deposit into the pile
Adjusting the angle of the arm to ensure insertion

tasks.task: Fencing with another person
subtasks: Facing an opponent in a fencing stance
Engaging in a bout, maintaining distance and parries
Attacking with thrusting or cutting motions
Ducking under or advancing to counter-attack
Finishing the bout

tasks.task: Walking with a weighted backpack
subtasks: Shouldering the pack with hip adjustment for balance
Maintaining an even stride while moving
Bending knees slightly to absorb ground impact
Touting as needed to shift weight

tasks.task: Carrying a log with a shoulder yoke
subtasks: Placing a log over the shoulder yoke
Walking with the log suspended between the shoulders
Alternating shoulders as needed for comfort
Balancing log to prevent sliding

tasks.task: Lifting a boulder onto a cart
subtasks: Approaching the boulder with a cart nearby
Kneeling to grasp the edges of the boulder
Using legs and core strength to lift the boulder
Rotating body to face the direction of the cart
Placing the boulder onto the cart, readjusting as needed

tasks.task: Kicking a test object with a cleat boot
subtasks: Setting the cleat boot on a target or barrier
Positioning the foot to contact the object with the cleat
Applying force with the leg to kick the object
Tracking the direction and aim of the kick

tasks.task: Clapping on command
subtasks: Standing in a ready position
Clenching hands together in a closed fist
Bringing the hands together to a clap with force
Separating hands back to starting position

tasks.task: Clapping and lifting a log with legs
subtasks: Balancing a log on legs
Clapping to initiate the lift
Using legs to rise with the log, maintaining balance
Lowering to release the log, clapping again

tasks.task: Survival diving into a pool
subtasks: Approach the edge of the pool in a dive position
Jumping from a crouched position into the water
Compacting air pockets in lungs before immersion
Surface quickly to check well-being
Perform a quick recovery if necessary

tasks.task: Hearing a bell
subtasks: Orienting to the sound of a bell
Locating the direction from which the sound is coming
Maintaining attention on the bell sound

tasks.task: Rock climbing up a boulder
subtasks: Locate footholds and handholds on the boulder
Ascend by alternating hand and foot movements
Utilizing legs for pulling power
Regulating breathing to maintain climb

tasks.task: Harnessing for rock climbing
subtasks: Attaching a safety harness around the waist and thighs
Connecting the harness to a rope or anchor points
Checking the connection for proper attachment

tasks.task: Aligning feet on footholds while rock climbing
subtasks: Placing toes into narrow cracks or foot pockets
Distributing body weight across the selected foothold
Shift weight to transfer to next foothold

tasks.task: Using a pickaxe for climbing
subtasks: Gripping the pickaxe with both hands
Placing the pick into the rock face for leverage
Pulling upwards to assist in ascending vertical surfaces

tasks.task: Crushing stones with a lever
subtasks: Positioning a lever mechanism over stones to be crushed
Applying force by moving the lever to press down
Monitoring the crushing effectiveness and adjusting force as needed

tasks.task: Splitting a stone with a sledgehammer
subtasks: Locating the split line on the stone using a mason's line or similar
Maintaining the hammer perpendicular to the split line
Delivering forceful blows in a steady rhythm to initiate and progress the split
Stopping once the split is complete to handle the resulting halves

The problem involves generating a list of physical tasks related to a given video transcript. The steps include breaking down each action performed in the transcript and categorizing them into major tasks (MAINTASK) and their respective subtasks (SUBTASK). The provided transcript describes various activities such as using a boulder chucker, carrying stones, throwing, digging, rock climbing, and more. Each of these activities is analyzed to identify the primary task and its component steps.
For each MAINTASK, the corresponding SUBTASKs detail the specific actions required. These tasks are presented in a step-by-step format, breaking down the major activities into manageable substeps.
